VerticalContentItem.Subject: Please verify your email address for your career network

ViewContentItem.ViewPartContentItem:
Dear <%=To.FirstName%>,

In order to protect your privacy we need you to verify that the email address you have supplied is correct. You will not be able to access the full functionality of the web site until this is done.

More importantly, employers may not be able to send possible job opportunities to you if your email address is not verified.

"> Please verify your email address now

If this link doesn't work, please copy and paste the following link into your browser: "> <%= TinyUrls.Register(false, "~/accounts/activation", "activationCode", VerificationCode) %>

Dear <%=To.FirstName%>,
In order to protect your privacy we need you to verify that the email address you have supplied is correct. You will not be able to access the full functionality of the web site until this is done.
More importantly, employers may not be able to send possible job opportunities to you if your email address is not verified.
Please use the link below to verify your email address:
<%=TinyUrls.Register(false, "~/accounts/activation", "activationCode", VerificationCode)%>

VerticalContentItem.Subject: Welcome to LinkMe: please confirm your details

ViewContentItem.ViewPartContentItem:
Dear <%=To.FirstName%>,

You recently joined LinkMe by either uploading your resume, applying for a job, joining a group or joining a network.

Please "> click here to confirm your details.

If this link doesn't work, please copy and paste the following link into your browser: "> <%= TinyUrls.Register(false, "~/accounts/activation", "activationCode", VerificationCode) %>

LinkMe is an online career network and resume database focused on you, for the life of your career. By having your resume on our site and your details up to date, you have the potential to be contacted by the many recruiters and employers searching for staff.

LinkMe is a quick and easy way to:

  • Be contacted by potential employers for job opportunities you may have otherwise missed

  • Have jobs sent to you that match your profile

  • Keep your resume updated and ready to use for the duration of your career

  • Make your resume either visible or invisible to employers

  • Search and apply for jobs

  • Network with friends and colleagues who can help you progress in your career

  • Access free career resources such as videos, sample resumes, personality tests and suggested connections

  • Keep your details private

We look forward to helping you throughout the life of your career.

Dear <%=To.FirstName%>,
You recently joined LinkMe by either uploading your resume, applying for a job, joining a group or joining a network.
Please use this link to confirm your details: <%=TinyUrls.Register(false, "~/accounts/activation", "activationCode", VerificationCode)%>
LinkMe is an online career network and resume database focused on you, for the life of your career. By having your resume on our site and your details up to date, you have the potential to be contacted by the many recruiters and employers searching for staff.
LinkMe is a quick and easy way to:
* Be contacted by potential employers for job opportunities you may have otherwise missed * Have jobs sent to you that match your profile * Keep your resume updated and ready to use for the duration of your career * Make your resume either visible or invisible to employers * Search and apply for jobs * Network with friends and colleagues who can help you progress in your career * Access free career resources such as videos, sample resumes, personality tests and suggested connections * Keep your details private
We look forward to helping you throughout the life of your career.

Thanks,

VerticalContentItem.Subject: You have been invited to the event '<%=Event.Name%>'

ViewContentItem.ViewPartContentItem:
Hi

You have been invited to the event <%=Event.Name%> by <%=From.FullName%>.

It starts on <%=Event.Time.Start.Value.ToString("d")%> at <%=Event.Time.Start.Value.ToString("t")%> and ends on <%=Event.Time.End.Value.ToString("d")%> at <%=Event.Time.End.Value.ToString("t")%>.

<% if(!String.IsNullOrEmpty(Event.Description)) { %>

Description: <%= Event.Description %>


<% } %> <% if(!String.IsNullOrEmpty(MessageText)) { %>

<%=MakeNamePossessive(From.FirstName)%> personal message:
<%=MessageText%>


<% } %>

">View event

VerticalContentItem.Subject: Your LinkMe status: Please confirm that you are still Actively Looking for Work

ViewContentItem.ViewPartContentItem:
Dear <%=To.FirstName%>,

You are currently listed on LinkMe as 'Actively Looking for Work'. To provide employers with your most accurate work status you should either:

  1. Confirm your ">Actively Looking for Work status, or

  2. ">Change your work status to reflect your current situation, or

  3. Do nothing and your work status will be changed automatically to 'Not Looking but Happy to Talk'.

By ensuring your work status is up to date, you increase your chances of being found and contacted by employers. Employers and recruiters can search for Immediately Available or active jobseekers, and can make their decisions to contact based on this information.

Please note: if you confirm your Actively Looking for Work status, this will need to be confirmed on a monthly basis.

Dear <%=To.FirstName%>,
You are currently listed on LinkMe as 'Actively Looking for Work'. To provide employers with your most accurate work status you should either:
1. Confirm your 'Actively Looking for Work' status using this link: <%=TinyUrls.Register(true, "~/members/profile/status/update", "status", "ActivelyLooking")%>
2. Change your work status using this link <%=TinyUrls.Register(true, "~/members/profile/status/update")%>
3. Do nothing and your work status will be changed automatically to 'Not Looking but Happy to Talk'.
By ensuring your work status is up to date, you increase your chances of being found and contacted by employers. Employers and recruiters can search for Immediately Available or active jobseekers, and can make their decisions to contact based on this information.
Please note: if you confirm your Actively Looking for Work status, this will need to be confirmed on a monthly basis.

VerticalContentItem.Subject: Your LinkMe work status has been automatically updated

ViewContentItem.ViewPartContentItem:
Dear <%=To.FirstName%>,

Your work status on LinkMe has been changed from 'Actively Looking for Work' to 'Not Looking but Happy to Talk'. This means that an employer who views your resume may think that you are no longer looking for work, and so may not contact you for opportunities.

If this is not accurate, you can ">change your work status to:

  1. 'Actively Looking for Work', or

  2. 'Immediately Available', or

  3. 'Not Looking for Work'

Please note that if you indicate that you are Immediately Available or Actively Looking for Work, your status will have to be confirmed regularly.

Dear <%=To.FirstName%>,
Your work status on LinkMe has been changed from 'Actively Looking for Work' to 'Not Looking but Happy to Talk'. This means that an employer who views your resume may think that you are no longer looking for work, and so may not contact you for opportunities.
If this is not accurate, you can use this link <%=TinyUrls.Register(true, "~/members/profile/status/update")%>
to change your work status to:
1. 'Actively Looking for Work', or
2. 'Immediately Available', or
3. 'Not Looking for Work'
Please note that if you indicate that you are Immediately Available or Actively Looking for Work, your status will have to be confirmed regularly.

VerticalContentItem.Subject: Your LinkMe status: Please confirm that you are still Immediately Available for work

ViewContentItem.ViewPartContentItem:
Dear <%=To.FirstName%>,

You are currently listed on LinkMe as 'Immediately Available for Work'. To provide employers with your most accurate work status you should either:

  1. Confirm you are still ">Immediately Available, or

  2. ">Change your work status to reflect your current situation, or

  3. Do nothing and your work status will be automatically changed to 'Actively Looking for Work'.

By ensuring your work status is up to date, you increase your chances of being found and contacted by employers. Employers and recruiters can search for Immediately Available or active jobseekers, and can make their decisions to contact based on this information.

Please note: if you confirm your Immediately Available status, this will need to be confirmed on a weekly basis.

Dear <%=To.FirstName%>,
You are currently listed on LinkMe as 'Immediately Available for Work'. To provide employers with your most accurate work status you should either:
1. Confirm you are still 'Immediately Available' using this link <%=TinyUrls.Register(true, "~/members/profile/status/update", "status", "AvailableNow")%>
2. Change your work status using this link <%=TinyUrls.Register(true, "~/members/profile/status/update")%>
3. Do nothing and your work status will be automatically changed to 'Actively Looking for Work'.
By ensuring your work status is up to date, you increase your chances of being found and contacted by employers. Employers and recruiters can search for Immediately Available or active jobseekers, and can make their decisions to contact based on this information.
Please note: if you confirm your Immediately Available status, this will need to be confirmed on a weekly basis.

VerticalContentItem.Subject: Your LinkMe work status has been automatically updated

ViewContentItem.ViewPartContentItem:
Dear <%=To.FirstName%>,

Your work status on LinkMe has been changed from 'Immediately Available' to 'Actively Looking for Work'. This means that when employers find your resume, they may assume that though you are looking for work, you may need to provide a notice period to your current employer.

If this is not accurate, you can ">change your work status to:

  1. 'Immediately Available', or

  2. 'Not Looking but Happy to Talk', or

  3. 'Not Looking for Work'

Please note that if you indicate that you are Immediately Available or Actively Looking for Work, your status will have to be confirmed regularly.

Dear <%=To.FirstName%>,
Your work status on LinkMe has been changed from 'Immediately Available' to 'Actively Looking for Work'. This means that when employers find your resume, they may assume that though you are looking for work, you may need to provide a notice period to your current employer.
If this is not accurate, you can use this link <%=TinyUrls.Register(true, "~/members/profile/status/update")%> to change your work status to:
1. 'Immediately Available', or
2. 'Not Looking but Happy to Talk', or
3. 'Not Looking for Work'
Please note that if you indicate that you are Immediately Available or Actively Looking for Work, your status will have to be confirmed regularly.
